{{Infobox football biography | playername = Nnamdi Oduamadi | image = | caption = | fullname = Nnamdi Chidiebere Oduamadi | dateofbirth = {{Birth date and age|1990|10|17|df=y}} | cityofbirth = [[Lagos]] | countryofbirth = [[Nigeria]] | height = {{Height|m=1.75}} | position = [[Forward (association football)#Winger|Winger]], [[Striker]] | currentclub = [[Torino F.C.|Torino]] | clubnumber = 90 | youthyears1 = 1997â2008 | youthclubs1 = [[Pepsi Football Academy]] | youthyears2 = 2009â2010 | youthclubs2 = [[A.C. Milan|Milan]] | years1 = 2010â2011 | clubs1 = [[A.C. Milan|Milan]] | caps1 = 1 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2011â | clubs2 = â [[Torino F.C.|Torino]] (loan) | caps2 = 3 | goals2 = 1 | nationalyears1 = | nationalcaps1 = | nationalgoals1 = | nationalyears2 = | nationalcaps2 = | nationalgoals2 = | medaltemplates = | pcupdate = 25 November 2011 | ntupdate = }} '''Nnamdi Chidiebere Oduamadi''' (born 17 October 1990), also known by his shirt name '''Odu''',{{cite news |title="Tormentone" nomi: Odu e Sokratis |url=http://www.milannews.it/?action=read&idnotizia=32039 |author=Alberto Vaneria |work=milannews.it |date=14 August 2010 |accessdate=19 September 2010 |language=Italian}} is a [[Nigeria]]n professional [[Association footballer|footballer]] who plays as a winger for [[Serie B]] club [[Torino F.C.|Torino]] on loan from [[A.C. Milan]]. == Club career == Born in [[Lagos]], Oduamadi started playing football at the local [[Pepsi Football Academy]] at the age of 7.{{cite web |title=Graduates |url=http://www.pepsifootballacademy.com/graduates |work=pepsifootballacademy.com |publisher=[[Pepsi Football Academy]] |accessdate=25 September 2010}}{{cite news |title=Internet e corsa: ecco Oduamadi, vice-Pato |url=http://archiviostorico.gazzetta.it/2010/agosto/18/Internet_corsa_Ecco_Oduamadi_vice_ga_10_100818019.shtml |author=Fabiana della Valle |newspaper=[[La Gazzetta dello Sport]] |page=12 |date=18 August 2010 |accessdate=18 September 2010 |language=Italian}} He left his home country in 2008 to join [[A.C. Milan|Milan]], although he was officially signed only in January 2009 due to bureaucratic issues. Oduamadi spent two seasons in the club's youth system and was a member of the [[A.C. Milan Primavera|under-20 side]] who won the [[Coppa Italia Primavera]] in 2010, 25 years after the team's last success in the competition.{{cite news |title=Il Milan del futuro vola con Verdi e Zigoni |url=http://archiviostorico.gazzetta.it/2010/aprile/15/Milan_del_futuro_vola_con_ga_10_100415017.shtml |author=Fabiana della Valle |newspaper=[[La Gazzetta dello Sport]] |page=13 |date=15 April 2010 |accessdate=18 September 2010 |language=Italian}} At the beginning of the [[2010â11 A.C. Milan season|2010â11 season]], Milan announced that [[Co-ownership (football)|half of the rights]] to Oduamadi were purchased by [[Genoa C.F.C.|Genoa]] for â¬3.5 million,{{cite web|url=http://www.acmilan.com/uploads/club/bilancio2010/pdf/Bilancio_Gruppo_Milan_10.pdf|title=AC Milan Group 2010 Annual Report|date=ca. April 2011|accessdate=11 June 2011|work=AC Milan|language=Italian}} as part of the deal that saw defender [[Sokratis Papastathopoulos]] move the other way.{{cite news |title=Official A.C. Milan press release |url=http://www.acmilan.com/NewsDetail_popup.aspx?idNews=124923 |work=acmilan.com |publisher=[[A.C. Milan|Associazione Calcio Milan]] |date=20 July 2010 |accessdate=19 September 2010}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}} The Nigerian, though, stayed at Milan, as they kept the rights to the actual use of the player.{{cite web |title=Calcio Mercato Squadre |url=http://www.legaseriea.it/it/serie-a-tim/calcio-mercato/squadre/-/trasferimento/1716 |work=legaseriea.it |publisher=[[Lega Serie A|Lega Nazionale Professionisti Serie A]] |accessdate=19 September 2010 |language=Italian}} He subsequently joined the first team permanently and made his official debut for the club in a [[Serie A|league]] game against [[Calcio Catania|Catania]] on 18 September 2010, coming off the bench in the last minutes.{{cite news |title=Weekly Italy youth report: Libor Kozak goal wins it for Lazio |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/article?contentId=2127008 |author=Rick D'Andrea |work=goal.com |date=20 September 2010 |accessdate=25 September 2010}} However, since he didn't get much playing time, he still played games for the youth team at times through the season as an over-age player,{{cite news |title=Ritorno in primavera per Oduamadi |url=http://www.milannews.it/?action=read&idnotizia=37031 |author=Pietro Mazzara |work=milannews.it |date=22 October 2010 |accessdate=25 February 2011 |language=Italian}} being also included in the squad for the annual [[Torneo di Viareggio|Viareggio Cup]].{{cite news |title=Milan youth team kicks off Viareggio Cup campaign today |url=http://www.acmilan.com/en/teams/youth_teams_news/132273 |work=acmilan.com |publisher=[[A.C. Milan|Associazione Calcio Milan]] |date=22 February 2011 |accessdate=25 February 2011}} On 24 May 2011, [[Adriano Galliani]] and [[Enrico Preziosi]] formed a verbal agreement to solve the players ownership including [[Kevin-Prince Boateng]], [[Alberto Paloschi]], [[Marco Amelia]] and [[Giacomo Beretta]]. The deal included Milan bought back Zigoni, Strasser and Oduamadi, and Genoa bought back Papastathopoulos.{{cite news|url=http://archiviostorico.gazzetta.it/2011/maggio/25/Boateng_del_Milan_Riscatto_milioni_ga_10_110525107.shtml|title=Boateng Ã¨ del Milan Riscatto da 7 milioni|date=25 May 2011|accessdate=11 June 2011|work=La Gazzetta dello Sport|language=Italian}} On 30th June, 2011, [[Torino F.C.|Torino]] have announced signing of Nnamdi Oduamadi on a temporary basis with an option for a co-ownership agreement from Milan.{{http://www.torinofc.it/content/view/8293/61/}} == International career == At international level, Oduamadi was first capped by [[Nigeria national under-17 football team|Nigeria U-17]] back when he was at the [[Pepsi Football Academy]].{{cite news |title=The Pepsi lad they call 'Igwe' |url=http://pepsifootballacademy.com/news/29-the-pepsi-lad-they-call-igwe |work=pepsifootballacademy.com |publisher=[[Pepsi Football Academy]] |month=August |year=2006 |accessdate=25 September 2010}} He went on to be called-up by [[Nigeria national under-20 football team|Nigeria U-20]] to take part in the [[2009 FIFA U-20 World Cup]], but eventually was cut from the final squad due to an hamstring injury.{{cite news |title=Injury knocks out Nigeria's Nnamdi Oduamadi from U-20 World Cup |url=http://www.vanguardngr.com/2009/09/injury-knocks-out-nigeria%E2%80%99s-nnamdi-oduamadi-from-u-20-world-cup/ |work=vanguardgr.com |publisher=Vanguard Media Limited |date=9 September 2009 |accessdate=25 September 2010}} Oduamadi made his full international debut for Nigeria against Kenya, on March 29, 2011, featuring as a second half substitute.{{Citation needed|date=April 2011}} == Statistics == ''As of 18 September 2010''. {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%; text-align:center; width=75%;" |- !rowspan=2 width=10%| '''Team''' !rowspan=2 width=7% | '''Season''' !colspan=2 width=10%| Domestic
